page.title: 05FARMING IN TYTHERINGTON
page.content: Farming around Tytherington is mainly{ {dairy.}Many of the farms have originated from farms dating back to {1791.}The average size farm is about 120-150 acres.The soil is a mix between{lown}soil, which everything can be planted on, and a heavy{clay} soil, which is suitable for wheat. The man we interviewed had 120 acres of land. 20 acres of this is lowlying land, which can get rather wet in the winter months. This year he is going to drain 10 acres of this. he has a rather old milking parlour which is not like the new{"Herring bone"}set up. He can have 6 cows in the parlour at once. But only milk 3 at once. He has 120 milkers and 50 calves. Not all of these are milked at once, some are {"dry"}cows.
